results.title: Romper Room
results.brief_description: At last, the longest running and most loved television pre-school program is on video for you to enjoy with your children. Join Miss Susan, Miss Patricia, Miss Helena and Miss Megan, and of course Mr. Do Bee, for all the favourite songs and games from Romper Room.

results.title: Feathers, fur or fins
results.brief_description: This delightful children’s program is a compilation of different episodes from the popular “Playmates” television series screened on the ABC, and it explores a wide range of Australian animals through songs and looking at animals. Contains some animated sequences.

results.title: Dinosaurs: fun, facts and fantasy
results.creator_credit: Clive Doig, Malcolm Craddock and Picture Palace Productions
results.brief_description: This informative and entertaining program is a mixture of puppets, songs, animated models, drawings, old film footage and dramatised sequences, and it will answer everything you ever wanted to know about dinosaurs.

results.title: Cockleshell Bay
results.brief_description: A series of short animated stories about Robin and Rosie Cockle who move to Cockleshell Bay with their parents to set up a guest house. Whilst there they befriend old Mr Ship and Gran Routie who help them in their play. Rated: G

results.title: Button Moon
results.brief_description: Mr and Mrs Spoon and Tina T Spoon live on Junk Planet where everything is created from household items. In each adventure they visit Button Moon in their space ship. Through their telescope they see lots of interesting stories. Rated: G

results.brief_description: A delightful, amusing puppet animation for children which involves two mischievous characters whose antics always lead to trouble. In this video, there are six separate episodes of fun and mischief.

results.title: A Story, a story
results.creator_credit: Gail E. Hailey, Morton Schindel, Kratky Film and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Nyame, the Sky God, demands a high price in exchange for his treasure. How Ananse paid the price is told in narration and woodcuts capturing the flavour of African languages, customs and lifestyles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gail E. Hailey, Morton Schindel, Kratky Film and Weston Woods Studios

results.title: South America: votes or violence
results.creator_credit: Anthony Isaacs, Jeremy Isaacs, Intertel and Rediffusion
results.brief_description: Examines the suitability of a democratic form of government for three Latin American countries - Bolivia, Brazil, Chile. It cannot be assumed that their political and economic problems can be solved by Western European methods. Bolivia cannot readily revive its economy based on a barren plateau of worked out mines. Brazil, with greater potential consists of ultra modern, prosperous cities and poverty stricken desert and jungle - should the government develop the profitable sections or tackle the desperate poverty? Chile with similar extremes of wealth, is experimenting with democracy. Written and narrated by James Cameron. Guitarist: John Williams. Intertel is a joint venture of Rediffusion London, Australian Broadcasting Commission, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, National Education T/V and Westinghouse Broadcasting Company of the United States.

results.title: Solomon Islands regain independence
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: On July 7, 1978, Solomon Islands regained its independence from Britain. Looks at the people of these islands and studies their way of life through their comments, songs and dances. Describes the problems facing the new nation and what is being done to combat them. Pidgin dialogue, English dialogue, English subtitles.
